Overview

The USC Tones Processing sample is a command line based application that performs /ANS and DTMF tones detection and tones generation.

The tones detector processes input PCM file either narrow band 16bit 8000 Hz or wideband 16bit 16000 Hz and creates one output text file. The output text file contains the textual name of the detect ed tone. If tone in input file aren’t detected than outfile is emp ty. The /ANS tone is 2100 Hz tone with phase reversals at 450 ms. The DTMF ( Dual-tone multi-frequency ) tone is sinusoidal tone of the two frequencies :

DTMF keypad frequencies
  1209 Hz 1336 Hz 1477 Hz 1633 Hz
697 Hz 1 2 3 A
770 Hz 4 5 6 B
852 Hz 7 8 9 C
941 Hz * 0 # D

The tones generator processes input parameters for generation: tones succession (for DTMF) or one tone (for ANS) duration of tone and pause, and amplitude level, and creates one output PCM file either narrow band 16bit 8000 Hz or wideband 16bit 16000 Hz.

The tone detection algorithm complies with ITU G.168-200 2 and Q.23 specifications.

Additional information on this software as well as other Intel ® Software Development Products is available at http://developer.intel.com/software/products/ .

How to Build Source Code

Build target by Microsoft Visual Studio

  • Set system environment variable IPPROOT
  • Open solution/project file in related Visual Studio
  • Select configuration/platform you need
  • Build all projects in Visual Studio

Running the Sample

For information on building the sample, see the readme file in the ipp_samples\ speech-codecs directory.

In order to run the executable created by this sample, the Intel®IPP DLLs must be on the system's path. DLLs are located in the bin subdirectory of the root directory of the Intel®IPP installation (IPPROOT). This can be done by setting the PATH environment variable manually or invoking the batch file: "%IPPROOT%\tools\ env\ippenv.bat " from the Intel®IPP installation.

  • To run the USC tones detector type: 

./usc_tones -dt -type DTMF/ANS [options] <inPCMFile> <outTextFile> 

The option list: 


  -fXXX               PCM frequency in kHz of the input file, where XXX equals 8000 or 16000.

 -n                       output additional information  (optional).

  -o <logFile>      write to <logFile> file log information (optional).
<inPCMFile> - input audio PCM file, 8000 Hz  or 16000 Hz

<outTextFile> - output text file. 

  • To run the USC tones generator type: 

usc_tones.exe -gtXXX/ Y -type DTMF/ANS [options] <outPCMFile>

The option list: 


  -fXXX                    PCM frequency in kHz of the output file, where XXX equals 8000 or 16000.

-gtXXX (or -gt Y)  where XXX is generated succession of tones are presented in table (DTMF), Y - generated one from tones: ANS, /ANS.

 -tXXX                   duration of tone in ms.

  -pXXX                  duration of pause in ms.

  -vXXX                  amplitude level in dB.

 -n                           output additional information  (optional).

  -o <logFile>          write to <logFile> file log information (optional).
<outPCMFile> -  output audio PCM file, 8000 Hz  or 16000 Hz
